title: States Swap One Drug For Another, And Botched Executions Follow
teaser: Oklahoma's botched execution of Clayton Lockett is prompting other states to question their use of the drug midazolam in lethal injections. The Lockett execution is fueling new calls to re-examine how states put inmates to death.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
